alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 1:31PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Johnson County through 200 PM MDT... At 129 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of Powder River Pass, or 12 miles southwest of Buffalo, with very slow movement to the northeast. HAZARD...Pea size hail and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...US Highway 16 west of Buffalo may be covered by small hail, and ponding of water is likely on the road surface. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Johnson County, including the following locations... South Fork Campground and Lost Cabin Campground. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 286 and 288. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County
